brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine the average risk for thyroid irradiation for any
      type of paediatric cardiac catheterization, based on the cummulative at-risk dose of  100
      mSv, adjusted to the measured thyroid volume and to the patient's age.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Thyroid Exposure to Radiation Doses During Paediatric Cardiac Catheterisations Performed for Diagnosis or the Treatment of Congenital Heart Disease

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Inclusion of any patient (< 18 year-old) with congenital heart disease undergoing one
             or more cardiac catheterization

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Exclusion of patients with any type of thyroid dissease

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Thyroid Exposure to Radiation Doses During Paediatric Cardiac Catheterisations Performed for Diagnosis or the Treatment of Congenital Heart Disease

oversight_info.authority: France: Afssaps - Agence française de sécurité sanitaire des produits de santé (Saint-Denis)

primary_outcome.description: To determine the average risk for thyroid irradiation for any type of paediatric cardiac catheterization, based on the cummulative at-risk dose of  100 mSv, adjusted to the measured thyroid volume and to the patient's age.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Fit the dose of average irradiation of the thyroid during the catheterizations to the thyroïdien volume

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
